HarPy API¶

To read a header-array file (HAR) from disk, use the static method loadFromDisk(filename). This will return an instance of harpy.HarFileObj(), which is a subclass of dict (though all keys can be get/set as attributes).

To write a HAR file to disk, first create an harpy.HarFileObj() object, and then execute the writeToDisk() method. Those methods, and other API methods, are shown below.

class harpy.HarFileObj(*args, filename: str = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

HAR file object - essentially a memory representation of a HAR file.

HarFileObj subclasses dict, and stores a list of harpy.HeaderArrayObj in self. Each harpy.HeaderArrayObj corresponds to a header-array. If HarFileObj is provided with filename, then the header-arrays in that file will be loaded - i.e. each harpy.HeaderArrayObj in self will correspond to a header-array in that file.

Every key in a HarFileObj can be get and set as an attribute.

The complete list of attributes is:

Parameters:head_arrs (list) – Returned/provided as a list of HeaderArrayObj defining all HeaderArrayObj associated with a file.

And the methods of HarFileObj are:

addHeaderArrayObj(ha_obj: harpy.header_array.HeaderArrayObj, idx: int = None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • ha_obj – A harpy.HeaderArrayObj object.
  • idx – The index of self["head_arrs"] at which to insert ha_obj.
addHeaderArrayObjs(ha_objs) → None[source]¶
Parameters:ha_objs ('Union[HeaderArrayObj,List[HeaderArrayObj]]') – Add one or more harpy.HeaderArrayObj to self.
getHeaderArrayNames()[source]¶
Returns:Returns the name of all harpy.HeaderArrayObj() stored with self.
getHeaderArrayObj(ha_name: str)[source]¶

Retrieve a single harpy.HeaderArrayObj.

Parameters:ha_name – The "name" of the harpy.HeaderArrayObj.
Returns:A harpy.HeaderArrayObj.
getHeaderArrayObjIdx(ha_name)[source]¶
Parameters:ha_name – Name of Header Array.
Return int:The list index of the harpy.HeaderArrayObj.
getHeaderArrayObjs(ha_names=None)[source]¶

Retrieve a list of harpy.HeaderArrayObj.

Parameters:ha_names ('Union[None,str,List[str]]') – The name or list of names of harpy.HeaderArrayObj. If None is provided (the default) then all harpy.HeaderArrayObj are returned.
Returns:list of harpy.HeaderArrayObj.
getRealHeaderArrayNames()[source]¶
Returns:Returns only the names of arrays of type 2D or 7D - i.e. multi-dimensional header arrays of floating point numbers.
static loadFromDisk(filename: str) → harpy.har_file.HarFileObj[source]¶

Loads a HAR file into memory, returning a HarFileObj.

Parameters:filename – The name of the file to load.
Returns:
readHeaderArrayObjs(filename: str, ha_names=None)[source]¶
Reads the header array objects with names ha_names from filename. If None (the default), read all header array objects. harpy.HeaderArrayObj are stored in self and can be retrieved with the self.getHeaderArrayObjs() method.
Parameters:
  • filename (str) –
  • ha_names ('Union[None,str,List[str]]') –
Returns:

None
removeHeaderArrayObjs(ha_names)[source]¶
Parameters:ha_names ('Union[str,List[str]]') – Remove one or more harpy.HeaderArrayObj from self.
writeToDisk(filename: str, ha_names=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • filename (str) – Writes harpy.HeaderArrayObj with ha_names to filename. If ha_names is None, write all the harpy.HeaderArrayObj stored in self.
  • ha_names ('Union[None,str,List[str]]') – The names of the header arrays to write to filename.
